page.title: 10LLANSTEFFAN AREA: WORK
page.content: The present very high unemployment rate is not reflected in Llansteffan and Llanybri. Comparatively few people are out of work at present, the majority being school-leavers. Although farming is the biggest and most important industry, relatively few people are actually engaged in it directly. The farms, shops, post offices, pubs, are all worked by the families owning or renting them and employ hardly any other workers. Tourism offers some part-time work and Coomb Cheshire Home at Llangynog employs a few people. Nearly everyone else works in Carmarthen, in shops, offices, hospitals, schools, the milk factory, construction and so on; and some go further afield. There are quite a lot of retired people here and many are active in the community in voluntary work.
